I think the best solution is to prevent deleting the user if the user owns a project until the user deletes the project he owns or change the owner. Otherwise, we will find out that a project does not have an owner, this also cause confusion.

@wangxj3 Hi, thanks for your contribution! There is a conflict, please resolve it~

The user_id of t_ds_project is the create user id. If we want to delete this user which create this project ,we should delete this project first,but this project may be visible and used by other users.May be functions that can be replaced by project owners is a choice.
Thanks, I have added your WeChat and my wechat  is guoshilin93

> The user_id of t_ds_project is the create user id. If we want to delete this user which create this project ,we should delete this project first,but this project may be visible and used by other users.May be functions that can be replaced by project owners is a choice.

Yeal, currently the `user_id` in `t_ds_project` table represents project creator, but I think it might be better to change its meaning to project owner, so that we can provide a method to update the project owner. Otherwise, once we delete the user, the project creator will be null.
@fanwq What do you think?
a project can be owned by more than one user, so i think it's better to define user_id as project creator other than owner. Project owners are defined in `t_ds_relation_project_user`.

> a project can be owned by more than one user, so i think it's better to define user_id as project creator other than owner. Project owners are defined in `t_ds_relation_project_user`.

I think the project owner should be only one, others just have the permission for the project, the relation is defined in `t_ds_relation_project_user `, and they should not be defined as owner. Or do you have other ways to solve the problem of user being null if we delete the user in the `t_ds_project`.

> where is the folder of driver??

the OJDBC jar is placed in the Dolphin installation directory lib folder, restart the dolphin api-server and worker-server.

> where is the folder of driver??

`$DOLPHINSCHEDULER_HOME/lib` like `/opt/dolphinscheduler/lib`

> @zhuangchong Hi, Zhaungchong, I have re-modified according to your suggestion, please help me review. And there seems some problem with code coverage calculate, some unit test are not added to the `SonarCloud`.

ok, let me take a look, please solve code coverage and code smell.
when delete the user  ,if he is a  the owner,  chose a new owner form the t_ds_relation_project_user .What do you think of this plan?

> when delete the user ,if he is a the owner, chose a new owner form the t_ds_relation_project_user .What do you think of this plan?

Agree, but I think you should let user choose a new owner from `t_ds_user`, because there may not relation in `t_ds_relation_project_user `. And how to interact if there are multiple project belongs to the delete user. 

This kind of problem also exists for `resource` and `processdefinition`, cause by store the `user_id`. This seems to be a large-scale issue.
